page.title: 17HIGH HURSTWOOD SOCIAL LIFE 1
page.content: Social life in High Hurstwood centres round the Village Hall and Recreation Ground which lie just to the South of our block. Here there is a thriving Cricket Club and Youth CLub with membership of some 36 boys and girls aged between l3 and 2l. There is a monthly Whist Drive and elsewhere a Scottish Dancing Group. The Hunt frequently passes through the village and the Joint Master of the Eridge and Southdown Foxhounds resides in the area. High Hurstwood Women's Institute meets monthly in the Hall, providing its 72 members with a choice of many activities including craft and cookery classes, drama and the opportunity to hear speakers on a wide variety of subjects such as travel, local history, art and music.
